Flicker continued building the transport, slipping an
exposive in right under the area for the cargo, and
hiding the detonator in his wrist compartment, as a
trump card incase of double-cross.

--- cardhead649 <cardhead649@...> wrote:
> Gatara::
> 
> The lumbering giant ducks through the entrance and
> begins sorting 
> through the various paraphernelia.  Some of the more
> exotic equipment 
> surprises her a bit, but she's more interested in
> the basics so far - 
> primarily engine components.
> 
> Riekan/Torin::
> 
> "How's our companion, Torin?" Riekan asks.  "All the
> procedures taken 
> care of?"
> 
> "Years ago, my friend," Torin replies as he
> reconnects damaged wires 
> behind a service panel.  "We've been prepared for
> something like this 
> for a long time.  It would take a master hacker to
> detect any of the 
> programs we installed - and a true legend to remove
> them without 
> doing permanent mental damage."
> 
> The two males share a sinister laugh ...
> 
> Phoenix::
> 
> The nightmares strike again.  Phoenix once again
> relives her most 
> traumatic experience, as Clawful comes closer and
> closer, a sickening 
> leer on his face; she does everything she can to
> fend him off, but 
> it's far from enough.  Once again she feels the pain
> and humiliation 
> that is every girl's worst fear ...
> 
> "NOOOOOO!!!"  The prisoner sits bolt upright,
> snapping awake.  
> Looking wildly around, she realizes once again it's
> been a long time 
> since that day.  She's stranded with her captors on
> some planet in 
> the distant past.  And Clawful, thankfully, is in
> his quarters in 
> stasis lock.  Finally, Phoenix manages to relax.
> 
> Jayde::
> 
> Phoenix is not the only one with the past in mind,
> as Jayde reaches 
> up to key the door to her sister's quarters.  Lunara
> is there, as 
> before, stasis-locked on the recharge bed.
> 
> "Lunara," Jayde whispers, even though she knows the
> larger bot can't 
> hear her, "please don't die on me."  The blue and
> black Rogue walks 
> over to Lunara's bedside.  "We've been together as
> long as I've been 
> online.  I don't know how I could get by without you
> in my life."  
> She reaches into her subspace compartment and pulls
> out a small disk 
> with a Maximal insignia on it.  A sad smile forms on
> her face.  
> 
> "You always told me to get rid of this, that it
> would just get me in 
> trouble.  I wish I could, but I just can't help
> thinking sometimes - 
> what would it be like, if we'd never left to join
> the Rogues?  Where 
> would we be now?  Would you still be drawing crowds
> with your songs 
> and dance routines?  Would we be off someplace, not
> knowing or caring 
> what some funky group of terrorists was up to - just
> like we don't 
> really care what our fellow Maximals are doing now?"
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > Flicker gets back to his shuttle, lands, and
> transforms.
> > 
> > Flicker:  Just pick out the stuff you need and
> I'll get the 
> transport 
> > ready.
> > 
> > He goes inside, takes a crowbar, and opens a crate
> with it and 
> begins 
> > to get out wheels.  Nearby is any almost
> inperceptible secret 
> > compartment, but he throws the lid of the box over
> it just in case.
> 
> 
>
